article_text:
General Motors Co. said it would delay by at least several months a feature allowing hands-free driving on highways, underscoring the challenges auto makers face in perfecting autonomous-vehicle technology.

GM’s so-called Super Cruise feature that can control speed, braking and keep vehicles in their lanes won’t be available until next year, the nation’s largest auto maker said in a statement. In October, GM said the semi-automated...
